data.title: So disappointing
data.text: Last time I was there I had moderate expectations. I had been there 2-3 times soon after Restaurant Impossible did the makeover, and the food at that time was wonderful (the salmon with sweet potato hash were great!), though a limited menu was put in place so that the quality could be kept up. However, right from the start the service was poor due to obvious lack of training, standards and supervision. So when I went back last year I wondered how it would be, so started with drinks in the "restaurant area" before ordering any dinner. The place was a dirty mess, the service was TERRIBLE, and we were the only people there for food.  Everything seemed to be reverting to what the place really is...a bar with karaoke, pool and dart boards, NOT a restaurant.  The drink & service were so poor that we couldn't even consider eating there, so moved on.  I remember how filthy the food prep area and ice machines were when RI arrived, and it's an easy guess that it's reverted back to that.  It seems pretty obvious that the owners don't give a hoot about cleanliness or running a bar-RESTAURANT.  I'm sorry to write such a critical review, but I'd feel bad if someone ate there and got sick. I hope the owners can find a business model that suits them better...obviously just the drinks/pool/darts/karaoke crowd IF they can make a go of it. Whatever, they need to start paying attention to cleanliness - even if it is just a bar.

data.title: All you want in a neighborhood watering hold
data.text:
They have the best cocktails and the food is great.  I've never been disappointed by anything that I ordered.  Get the chicken Caesar salad, the street tacos and ask about the Zipperdoodle - you'll be glad you did :)  

My only problem is that there seems to be karaoke all the time.  The place is small and if you don't feel like listening to LOUD music - some of it pretty bad - steer clear of here after around 9.

data.title: Going down
data.text: I agree with the other reviews! I've gobe there twice when they were supposed to be open but they weren't ready to serve us. She you only have 45 minutes to an hour for lunch you want to get seated and served right away so you at least have 20-25?minutes to eat. I didn't see much change with the remodel and its just not the place I enjoyed so much. I won't be going back!

data.title: Drinks
data.text:
Only been here for drinks but had lots of fun ,
 For five times can hear on karaoke night great stuff. They make a very good drink very friendly people that work there good pool table. You will have fun at smoky monkey in the evenings .

data.title: Strange place
data.text: This place was made over by the TV show "Restaurant Impossible" months ago.  I've been to the Monkey before and after and I have to say, it's not really any better today than it was prior to the remodel.  It seems to have a local flavor with a handful of regulars that frequent the bar.

data.title: Not very good
data.text: Spunky monkey used to be one of my favorite places but has down hill. They recently remodeled but doesn't look like much change. The food is good but the restaurant isn't very clean. Although smoking inside has been banned for several years it still smells like cigarettes and or dirty mop water

data.title: Didn't try the food
data.text: Went to karaoke on Saturday with friends. We didn't have any food here just drinks. The place was pretty packed. The service was surprisingly good. The karaoke was fun. The bathroom is in an odd location. The pool tables in the back were good. Wasn't sure where to park. All in all it wasn't a bad place to go and do some karaoke.

data.title: best steak in Auburn!!!!
data.text: I've had this steak now 3 times, and it has been excellent every time!!!!  I'd recommend it for sure!!!!!!!!!!

data.title: Hope it works out
data.text:
This is a place that went through some tough times and got a boost from restaurant makeover. It looked good from the outside and then you had to see what a mess the show really did to them.

It was cleaned up and made over and the food was very good. The problem is the show left such a mess to clean up with all the expense going to the owners. Things have began to take its toll on the help, the food, and the bar and the grill. I feel the owner and the management fell down and have not been able to recover. 

They are having a tough time keeping help and also as the other reviews have said the food is a little sparse  for the type of place it is. It is a bar and grill after all not a stupid expensive place over looking the bay in Seattle.

They lost a lot of regulars after the show because the show took out the pool tables, TV's and music which was all part of the bar and made the bar area the restaurant and closed down stairs which was the restaurant. Stupid on the shows part. They make it look so nice on the show and in fact the show did a pretty bad and shameful job on the place and then supposedly the owner had to sign a agreement they would not change anything for x # of days.

The reviewers have really put this place down which is a shame because it does deserve a chance to get better. They are probably people who didn't come to this place before the show and saw it on TV and then expected a 5 star bar and grill which it is not at this time. 

It is true about the the service and the food but the management is working hard to change it for the better. It is not always bad and in fact I have never had bad food there and have ate there at least 6 times since the re-opening. It is too bad the owner or the manager has not come forward to tell their story and the expense they have had to deal with one of which I'll tell is the cut cables for the TVs and the cut wiring that has had to be replaced. It is too bad they can't go after the show for the crap they did.

data.title: restaurant was featured as a “restaurant makeover on restaurant impossible”, so I thought it was going to be inviting “N
data.text:
Thursday 2/27/14
Took 2 friends to the Spunky Monkey Restaurant in Auburn, WA, WOW was that a BIG mistake.  If there were a negative number I would post it.  The restaurant was featured as a “restaurant makeover on restaurant impossible”, so I thought it was going to be inviting “NOT”.    
We walked in and there was no one to greet you, headed to the dining area, where a man in dirty clothes said “it’s closed, go up to the bar” this was at 6:20pm).   We went up stairs to the bar, waited to be seated, took a few minutes, (only 5 people in the bar 4 staff members); we were seated in a booth which had a broken table.  
After we ordered, It took the kitchen staff 45 minutes to deliver our meal; I have to give the wait staff credit, a couple of staff members, kept apologizing about the wait.
I ordered, Beef & Blue Burger (salsa was slimy – scrapped it off) burger was cook per order, BUT the 5 wedges on the plate 2 cooked 3 raw (gross).  
My Friends order the Fish Sandwich, fish was dry, roll seemed to be day old, the other ordered Steak, and it was as tough as shoe leather, veggies over cooked. 
This restaurant is NOT inviting, VERY POOR quality of food preparation and extremely long period of time between order and delivery.
I paid the bill, because I was so embarrassed about the place I chose for guest.    
I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND THIS PLACE EVER!    
I will also be sending the show Restaurant Impossible a CC of this post.

data.title: Disappointed...small food proportions
data.text:
I just had a lunch here and must say I was pretty disappointed. First of all, it's a strange entry having to go up a bunch of stairs. Right at the top of the stairs in the entry/circulation area they had a table with people seated which you had to go around tightly to get to the rest of the restaurant (fire hazard anyone?) 

The menu was just a single piece of paper. I asked about one lunch option and the server couldn't even describe it well at all...so, ended up ordering a blue cheese burger. Once it arrived, I was pretty shocked to see it with just 5 little Jo Jo's that they tried to "stylistically" arrange on the plate. I stared at it going, "are you serious?"  

The server lady pretty much plopped it down and ran off, so I had to quickly call to her if I could get some ketchup. Uh, duh..its a burger and jo jo's people! She then came back with this very small half filled cup of ketchup. I had to ask if I could please get some more or just have the bottle. But of course they couldn't bring out the bottle!  

The burger itself was pretty good, but was a bit underdone (I asked for medium and it had a bit of pink in the middle). Otherwise it was ok.

So, after sitting getting a bit upset at the ultra small food servings, I finally asked the server why they served just 5 little jo jo's and she said something like, "well, we were just featured on a food channel show and that was their menu serving." I was pretty much in shock hearing that from her...hello, I DON'T CARE you were on some show...don't shortchange your customers!   

Anyway, the whole place gives off a stench of hipster pretentiousness. It was pretty obvious that they were more concerned with how a plate looks (a few cutely arranged Jo Jo's), than giving their customers an actual honest meal.  That act might work in Belltown or Kirkland, but is soooo out of place in Auburn. I highly recommend staying away, whatever "food show" they were on has obviously gone to their head. Not worth it. 
* * *

data.title: Don't waste your time or money
data.text: The food was overcooked. The drinks were watered down. The service sucked. I thought the place would have been better since the make over.

data.title: Great food and great service
data.text: We've frequented this restaurant for over 10 years.  I'm surprised to read of some of the recent experiences.  We've visited twice since the Restaurant Impossible remodel.  We've found the menu offers variety and exciting new options.  The service is excellent and attentive.  The chef has delivered our food and chatted with us about our experience.  The owner has been present and attentive as well.  Our service has been very good.  We continue to appreciate the experience and will continue to frequent the Spunky Monkey.  I highly recommend the Caesar Burger (they have a great Caesar Salad).  My boyfriend loves the pasta dishes.

data.title: Just ok
data.text:
Not much choice on the menu. Food was a little overcooked. Was very disappointed. I had heard good things and saw they had remodeled. Seating was minimal. Decor was blah. Won't go again.

Waitress was great though. Definitely need to change the name. It is NOT spunky!

data.title: terrible service
data.text: Restaurant Impossible came in & apparently tried to save this place from itself.  It's going to take more than a fresh coat of paint & some new furniture for me to go back.  I had not gone before the tv show came in, so I have nothing to compare it to.  I went in last night with a party of 8 for cocktails.  We waited & waited for our server.  There were only customers at 2 other tables at the time, so she wasnt busy serving other people, so I dont know what took her so long.  My husband asked what type bourbon they had.  She told him to get up & go look for himself, that it's on the far left end of the bar.  Uh, no.  We got our drinks in a reasonable amount of time.  She brought my husband's bourbon neat instead of on the rocks.  We can forgive that.  She went & got him a glass of ice & he poured it himself.  She said she would bring water for everyone.  She got half of us water, but not the other half.  She never came back to see if we needed another round.  A friend of mine that works at a different restaurant in town was there.  She came over to say hi & asked why our glasses were all empty.  Because our server hasnt come back to check on us.  Anyway, a while later,our gal comes back.  Not to ask if we needed anything, but to tell us her shift was over & she was leaving & our new server would be over.  Time passes, she finally comes over.  By then we had given up hope of getting another drink, so we just left.  We were one row of tables away from the bar.  Yes, I coulda waved my hands around & gotten somebody to come wait on us if I wanted to bad enough, but that's not my job.  It's THEIR job.  So yeah, I wont be back.

data.title: Zero spunk at the new Monkey.
data.text: I used to bring all my friends here and tell them, "You HAVE to come to this bar, it's so much fun!"  That is no longer the case.  If you're looking to have a good time, go somewhere else because there's nothing to do here any more.  If you're looking for good food, Tacoma and Seattle have much better options and a wider variety.  This bar has essentially turned into a dull pencil.  Gray and pointless.

data.title: it USED to be a great TIKI bar ... tragic, really
data.text:
Our Opinion:

Once Upon a Time, we Loved it.

This place used to have the delightful audacity to encourage customers to feel like they were stranded on Gilligan's Island.  It had THE BEST Tiki Jungle theme decor!!!!

We always loved the tropical feel, and the way this restaurant had separated itself from the Typical Hipster scene.

We are so GROSSLY DISAPPOINTED with Spunky Monkey's choice to allow Restaurant Impossible to absolutely obliterate, and RUIN, their main theme.

While we never believed this restaurant was 'in trouble,' or in need of any type of facelift (for heaven's sake, it was MEANT to be UNIQUE), we know that the owner's decision was most likely made in hopes of drawing a new/different crowd.

Well... they're going to get that.  Unfortunately, there is no longer ANYthing that distinguishes this place from every other linear, watered-down, faux-Hip eatery.  It looks just BORING.

Plain and simple, the real draw has always been the THEME.  It was like a good old Trader Vics, but it was just "down the street" and a lot more affordable.  Tiki bars in the U.S. are all but non-existent anymore.

Fact: we liked the food; but it's the kind of food you can get anywhere else.

A lot of folks buy into the idea that "change is good."  And we agree in some cases.  But don't fix what isn't broken.  This little Tiki charmer was such a great little escape for so many years!  Gone are the wild tropical plants, and the wonderful, colorful walls.

It's just a shame.

Our decision to post this review was made because we certainly don't want any new patrons to be confused, deceived, or disappointed by what they find at the Spunky Monkey.  Sadly, the original Tiki Tropical Jungle Theme at the Spunky Monkey is no longer.

We hope the best for this restaurant, and guess that most regulars won't be fair-weathered fans.  But we're off to pursue the next out-of-the-way and unusual place that doesn't try so hard to conform to standardization.

data.title: Great New Atmosphere!
data.text: We went for lunch today because we wanted to see what changed after Restaurant Impossible visited the Spunky Monkey. The changes are FANTASTIC! The interior looks great. The dining area is nice, the bar looks great and the food was amazing.

data.title: Descent Spot
data.text: Laid Back Atmosphere. Not Great, But Descent Burgers. A Little Bit Chilly, Of Course It's January And Only 29° Outside....

data.title: My Favorite Bar!
data.text: I have been going to this bar regularly for about 5 years and I love it.  I have been too many other bars, but this is the place for me.  There is a large group of very welcoming regulars who are always accepting of other people.  It definitely has a family atmosphere with people looking out for each other.  The staff is amazing and very attentive.  The karaoke host are amazing too and work hard to make sure you have a great time.  They even try to ad songs that you request!  As another reviewer said, many of the fights are often times people who aren't regular, but 90% of the time it has a peaceful atmosphere.  Oh and the food is great too, even the fried munchies!  The temperature is controlled too, and it does not stink.  Come check it out!
